list_definition.definition: a person employed as a car-driver for a rich or important person

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We are looking for a private chauffeur to drive a limousine in central London.

list_ex_of_english: Next are the general run of professional chauffeurs and the average, owner-driver.
Would not these working-class car owners who could not get time off to drive the cars themselves send their chauffeurs?
Women are allowed to fly aircraft, though they must be chauffeured to the airport.
If chauffeurs are necessary let them be chauffeurs and not policemen.
I do not believe that every professional driver—chauffeurs, and so on—drinks.
Hotel services and chauffeurs are also in higher demand because of gambling.
On official engagements he was chauffeured about in a large limousine.
